CVE-2024-56509
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-27T19:09:07

2 posts

### Summary Improper input validation in the application can allow attackers to perform local file read (LFR) or path traversal attacks. These vulnerabilities occur when user input is used to construct file paths without adequate sanitization or validation. For example, using `file:../../../etc/passwd` or `file: ///etc/passwd` can bypass weak validations and allow unauthorized access to sensitive

cR0w at 2024-12-27T18:59:20.114Z ##

Anyone use changedetection dot io to watch for site changes or to see when some fancy new game is back in stock? They have a sev:HIGH ../

I know it's not likely to be a priority but I'm tired of enterprise stuff today so here's a fun little one, as a treat.

CVE-2024-56509: https://github.com/dgtlmoon/changedetection.io/security/advisories/GHSA-j5vv-6wjg-cfr8

#directoryTraversalMemes

CVE-2024-12856
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-27T18:30:32

6 posts

The Four-Faith router models F3x24 and F3x36 are affected by an operating system (OS) command injection vulnerability. At least firmware version 2.0 allows authenticated and remote attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands over HTTP when modifying the system time via apply.cgi. Additionally, this firmware version has default credentials which, if not changed, would effectively change this vulnera

screaminggoat at 2024-12-28T17:36:53.958Z ##

VulnCheck: Four-Faith Industrial Router CVE-2024-12856 Exploited in the Wild
CVE-2024-12856 (7.2 high) Four-Faith Industrial Router post-auth command injection is a reported exploited zero-day. Suricata rule available, no IOC though.

##

CVE-2024-3393(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-27T12:30:41

18 posts

A Denial of Service vulnerability in the DNS Security feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows an unauthenticated attacker to send a malicious packet through the data plane of the firewall that reboots the firewall. Repeated attempts to trigger this condition will cause the firewall to enter maintenance mode.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-27T04:00:43.815Z ##

Merry fucking Christmas from Palo Alto Networks (Zero-Day): CVE-2024-3393 PAN-OS: Firewall Denial of Service (DoS) in DNS Security Using a Specially Crafted Packet
CVE-2024-3393 (CVSSv4: 8.7 high) A Denial of Service vulnerability in the DNS Security feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows an unauthenticated attacker to send a malicious packet through the data plane of the firewall that reboots the firewall. Repeated attempts to trigger this condition will cause the firewall to enter maintenance mode.

Palo Alto Networks is aware of customers experiencing this denial of service (DoS) when their firewall blocks malicious DNS packets that trigger this issue.

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #paloaltonetworks #cve #CVE_2024_3393 #christmas

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-27T04:00:43.000Z ##

Merry fucking Christmas from Palo Alto Networks (Zero-Day): CVE-2024-3393 PAN-OS: Firewall Denial of Service (DoS) in DNS Security Using a Specially Crafted Packet
CVE-2024-3393 (CVSSv4: 8.7 high) A Denial of Service vulnerability in the DNS Security feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows an unauthenticated attacker to send a malicious packet through the data plane of the firewall that reboots the firewall. Repeated attempts to trigger this condition will cause the firewall to enter maintenance mode.

Palo Alto Networks is aware of customers experiencing this denial of service (DoS) when their firewall blocks malicious DNS packets that trigger this issue.

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #paloaltonetworks #cve #CVE_2024_3393 #christmas

Merry fucking Christmas from Palo Alto Networks (Zero-Day): CVE-2024-3393 PAN-OS: Firewall Denial of Service (DoS) in DNS Security Using a Specially Crafted Packet
CVE-2024-3393 (CVSSv4: 8.7 high) A Denial of Service vulnerability in the DNS Security feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows an unauthenticated attacker to send a malicious packet through the data plane of the firewall that reboots the firewall. ##
cR0w at 2024-12-27T22:12:39.745Z ##

Heads-up if you're working on CVE-2024-3393:

PAN changed the advisory so that the required configuration for exposure is now:

Both of the following must be true for PAN-OS software to be affected:

  • Either a DNS Security License or an Advanced DNS Security License must be applied.
  • DNS Security logging must be enabled.

Instead of this:

DNS Security logging must be enabled for this issue to affect PAN-OS software.

##
AAKL at 2024-12-27T17:32:57.515Z ##

Palo Alto update: CVE-2024-3393 PAN-OS: Firewall Denial of Service (DoS) in DNS Security Using a Specially Crafted Packet https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-3393 @paloaltontwks #cybersecurity #infosec

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-27T16:50:09.000Z ##

Hackers exploit DoS flaw to disable Palo Alto Networks firewalls

Palo Alto Networks is warning that hackers are exploiting the CVE-2024-3393 denial of service vulnerability to disable firewall protections by...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/zmeyy3

##
SecurityWriter at 2024-12-27T16:41:03.588Z ##

CVE-2024-3393

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-12-27T16:33:19.000Z ##

If anybody is dealing with the Palo Alto CVE-2024-3393 situation - they've neglected to mention they haven't yet released updates for the different impacted versions, so the temp mitigation is turn off logging in your anti-spyware policies if update isn't out yet.

##
todb at 2024-12-27T14:43:40.651Z ##

So PANW firewalls can be coerced into maintenance mode (CVE-2024-3393).

If you know the serial number, and you can reach the management interface, you can then SSH to it and do debug things. (So says https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA10g000000ClQVCA0 )

Otherwise, it’s failed closed. No more networking until you fix it.

For people who know more about PANW: are serial numbers secret? They don’t seem to be directly reflected in MAC addresses, so yay there.

Just trying to figure out if this is not mere DoS but more like one step toward privesc.

I don’t think it is, but there’s plenty of insider threat potential since people don’t typically guard serial numbers like passwords.

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-12-27T03:50:02.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks Firewall Vulnerability “CVE-2024-3393” Exploited in the Wild https://cybersecuritynews.com/palo-alto-networks-firewall-vulnerability/ #ComputerSecurityNews #CyberSecurityNews #VulnerabilityNews #cybersecuritynews #cybersecurity #vulnerability #CyberNews

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-27T22:12:39.000Z ##

Heads-up if you're working on CVE-2024-3393:

PAN changed the advisory so that the required configuration for exposure is now:

Both of the following must be true for PAN-OS software to be affected:

  • Either a DNS Security License or an Advanced DNS Security License must be applied.
  • DNS Security logging must be enabled.

Instead of this:

DNS Security logging must be enabled for this issue to affect PAN-OS software.

todb@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-27T14:43:40.000Z ##

So PANW firewalls can be coerced into maintenance mode (CVE-2024-3393).

If you know the serial number, and you can reach the management interface, you can then SSH to it and do debug things. (So says https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA10g000000ClQVCA0 )

Otherwise, it’s failed closed. No more networking until you fix it.

For people who know more about PANW: are serial numbers secret? They don’t seem to be directly reflected in MAC addresses, so yay there.

Just trying to figure out if this is not mere DoS but more like one step toward privesc.

I don’t think it is, but there’s plenty of insider threat potential since people don’t typically guard serial numbers like passwords.

CVE-2020-9253
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-27T12:30:41

4 posts

There is a stack overflow vulnerability in some Huawei smart phone. An attacker can craft specific packet to exploit this vulnerability. Due to insufficient verification, this could be exploited to tamper with the information to affect the availability. (Vulnerability ID: HWPSIRT-2019-11030) This vulnerability has been assigned a Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) ID: CVE-2020-9253.

CVE-2020-9236
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-27T12:30:41

A command injection is possible through the user interface, allowing arbitrary command execution as the root user. oMG2000 running MGOS 3.15.1 or earlier is affected.  MG90 running MGOS 4.2.1 or earlier is affected.

updated 2024-12-26T20:23:59

4 posts

Authentication Bypass by Assumed-Immutable Data vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server. This issue affects Apache HugeGraph-Server: from 1.0.0 before 1.5.0. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.5.0, which fixes the issue.

TomSellers at 2024-12-24T15:50:13.766Z ##

@cR0w Some bare data is available here w/o a login.

CVE-2024-43441: Apache HugeGraph-Server: Fixed JWT Token(Secret)
Severity: important

Affected versions:

  • Apache HugeGraph-Server 1.0 ~ 1.3 (before 1.5.0)

Description:

Authentication Bypass by Assumed-Immutable Data vulnerability in
Apache HugeGraph-Server.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.5.0, which fixes the issue.

Credit:

L0ne1y (reporter)

https://lists.apache.org/list.html?dev@hugegraph.apache.org

CVE-2024-12908
(6.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-26T18:30:37

2 posts

Delinea addressed a reported case on Secret Server v11.7.31 (protocol handler version 6.0.3.26) where, within the protocol handler function, URI's were compared before normalization and canonicalization, potentially leading to over matching against the approved list. If this attack were successfully exploited, a remote attacker may be able to convince a user to visit a malicious web-page, or open

cR0w at 2024-12-26T16:43:33.552Z ##

Code injection in Delinea on-prem Secret Server. CVSS3.1: 6.9

Looks like kind of a neat abuse of Punycode. The NIST advisory says it impacts Secret Server version 11.7.31 but the advisory applies to the Protocol Handler version and impacts all versions below 6.0.3.27 . I think that's the more important version to audit than the Secret Server version.

https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/december/cve-2024-12908-delinea-protocol-handler---remote-code-execution-via-update-process/

https://docs.delinea.com/online-help/secret-server/release-notes/ss-rn-11-7-000049.htm

CVE-2024-12908: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12908

updated 2024-12-26T17:02:48

11 posts

The `ObjectSerializationDecoder` in Apache MINA uses Java’s native deserialization protocol to process incoming serialized data but lacks the necessary security checks and defenses. This vulnerability allows attackers to exploit the deserialization process by sending specially crafted malicious serialized data, potentially leading to remote code execution (RCE) attacks. CVE-2024-50379
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-26T15:29:26

9 posts

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition vulnerability during JSP compilation in Apache Tomcat permits an RCE on case insensitive file systems when the default servlet is enabled for write (non-default configuration). This issue affects Apache Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.1, from 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.33, from 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.97. Users are recommended to upgrade to version

https://github.com/ph0ebus/Tomcat-CVE-2024-50379-Poc

https://github.com/lizhianyuguangming/CVE-2024-50379-exp

AAKL at 2024-12-23T16:41:32.582Z ##

Apache fixes remote code execution bypass in Tomcat web server https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/apache-fixes-remote-code-execution-bypass-in-tomcat-web-server/ @BleepingComputer

Apache advisory: CVE-2024-56337 Apache Tomcat - RCE via write-enabled default servlet - CVE-2024-50379 mitigation was incomplete https://lists.apache.org/thread/b2b9qrgjrz1kvo4ym8y2wkfdvwoq6qbp #cybersecurity #infosec

##
marreg@digitalcourage.social at 2024-12-20T17:42:57.000Z ##

CVE-2024-56337: Apache Tomcat: RCE due to TOCTOU issue in JSP compilation - CVE-2024-50379 mitigation was incomplete !

Severity: important

Affected versions:

- Apache Tomcat 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.1
- Apache Tomcat 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.33
- Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.97

Description:

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition vulnerability in Apache Tomcat.

This issue affects Apache Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.1, from 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.33, from 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.97.

The mitigation for CVE-2024-50379 was incomplete.

Tomcat 11.0.3, 10.1.35 and 9.0.99 onwards will include checks that sun.io.useCanonCaches is set appropriately before allowing the default servlet to be write enabled on a case insensitive file system. Tomcat will also set sun.io.useCanonCaches to false by default where it can.

References:

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-50379
https://lists.apache.org/thread/b2b9qrgjrz1kvo4ym8y2wkfdvwoq6qbp
https://tomcat.apache.org/
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-56337

##
decio at 2024-12-20T09:02:15.028Z ##

Une #vulnerabilite critique, identifiée comme CVE-2024-50379, a été découverte dans Apache Tomcat. Cette faille est due à une condition de concurrence (race condition) lors de la compilation des JSP (JavaServer Pages) sur des systèmes de fichiers insensibles à la casse, tels que Windows.

Pour qu'un attaquant puisse exploiter cette vulnérabilité et exécuter du code à distance, deux conditions doivent être réunies :

  • Le servlet par défaut de Tomcat doit être configuré pour autoriser l'écriture, ce qui n'est pas la configuration par défaut

  • Le système doit utiliser un système de fichiers insensible à la casse, permettant à des fichiers comme "test.jsp" et "TEST.JSP" d'être traités de manière identique.

Il est recommandé de mettre à jour Apache Tomcat vers les versions corrigées (9.0.98, 10.1.34, 11.0.2) et de vérifier que le servlet par défaut n'autorise pas l'écriture, sauf si cela est absolument nécessaire.

[Advisory]
👇
https://lists.apache.org/thread/y6lj6q1xnp822g6ro70tn19sgtjmr80r

[PoC]
👇
https://github.com/iSee857/CVE-2024-50379-PoC/tree/main
👇
https://github.com/yiliufeng168/CVE-2024-50379-POC

#CyberVeille #TomCat #CVE_2024_50379

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-19T17:08:04.623Z ##

Apache Tomcat security advisory 17 December 2024 CVE-2024-50379 Apache Tomcat - RCE via write-enabled default servlet
CVE-2024-50379 (9.8 critical) RCE (remote code execution) due to TOCTOU (time-of-check to time-of-use) issue in JSP compilation. No mention of exploitation.

#apache #tomcat #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_50379 #infosec #cybersecurity

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-20T09:02:15.000Z ##

Une #vulnerabilite critique, identifiée comme CVE-2024-50379, a été découverte dans Apache Tomcat. Cette faille est due à une condition de concurrence (race condition) lors de la compilation des JSP (JavaServer Pages) sur des systèmes de fichiers insensibles à la casse, tels que Windows.

Pour qu'un attaquant puisse exploiter cette vulnérabilité et exécuter du code à distance, deux conditions doivent être réunies :

  • Le servlet par défaut de Tomcat doit être configuré pour autoriser l'écriture, ce qui n'est pas la configuration par défaut

  • Le système doit utiliser un système de fichiers insensible à la casse, permettant à des fichiers comme "test.jsp" et "TEST.JSP" d'être traités de manière identique.

Il est recommandé de mettre à jour Apache Tomcat vers les versions corrigées (9.0.98, 10.1.34, 11.0.2) et de vérifier que le servlet par défaut n'autorise pas l'écriture, sauf si cela est absolument nécessaire.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-24T02:02:37.203Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
CVE-2021-44207 (8.1 high) Acclaim Systems USAHERDS Use of Hard-Coded Credentials Vulnerability

Mandiant mentioned back on 08 March 2022 (Does This Look Infected? A Summary of APT41 Targeting U.S. State Governments) as being exploited by the Chinese state-sponsored APT41. APT41, aka Brass Typhoon/Barium and RedGolf, is publicly attributed to the Chinese company Chengdu 404 by the U.S. Government.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-24T02:09:41.118Z ##

Adobe zero-day: APSB24-107 Security updates available for Adobe ColdFusion
CVE-2024-53961 (7.4 high) Adobe ColdFusion arbitrary file system read

Adobe is aware that CVE-2024-53961 has a known proof-of-concept that could cause an arbitrary file system read.

If you want vulnerability details, the reporter ma4ter previously reported on a similar Adobe ColdFusion Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability CVE-2024-20767 🤔

EDIT: Additional details: It's CWE-22 (Path Traversal), and Adobe considers it a Priority 1 (vulnerability being targeted or higher risk of being targeted)

#adobe #zeroday #vulnerability #cve_2024_53961 #cve #infosec #proofofconcept #CVE_2024_20767 #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-53961 (7.4 high) Adobe ColdFusion arbitrary file system read

Adobe is aware that CVE-2024-53961 has a known proof-of-concept that could cause an arbitrary file system read.

If you want vulnerability details, the reporter ma4ter previously reported on a similar Adobe ColdFusion Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability CVE-2024-20767 🤔

##

CVE-2024-45387
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-23T20:56:27

6 posts

An SQL injection vulnerability in Traffic Ops in Apache Traffic Control <= 8.0.1, >= 8.0.0 allows a privileged user with role "admin", "federation", "operations", "portal", or "steering" to execute arbitrary SQL against the database by sending a specially-crafted PUT request. Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Traffic Control 8.0.2 if you run an affected version of Traffic Ops.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-24T05:16:19.000Z ##

CVE-2024-56362
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-23T20:17:45

2 posts

Navidrome stores the JWT secret in plaintext in the `navidrome.db` database file under the `property` table. This practice introduces a security risk because anyone with access to the database file can retrieve the secret. The JWT secret is critical for the authentication and authorization system. If exposed, an attacker could: - Forge valid tokens to impersonate users, including administrative ac

Apache fixes remote code execution bypass in Tomcat web server https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/apache-fixes-remote-code-execution-bypass-in-tomcat-web-server/ @BleepingComputer

Apache advisory: CVE-2024-56337 Apache Tomcat - RCE via write-enabled default servlet - CVE-2024-50379 mitigation was incomplete https://lists.apache.org/thread/b2b9qrgjrz1kvo4ym8y2wkfdvwoq6qbp #cybersecurity #infosec

##
marreg@digitalcourage.social at 2024-12-20T17:42:57.000Z ##

CVE-2024-56337: Apache Tomcat: RCE due to TOCTOU issue in JSP compilation - CVE-2024-50379 mitigation was incomplete !

Severity: important

Affected versions:

- Apache Tomcat 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.1
- Apache Tomcat 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.33
- Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.97

Description:

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition vulnerability in Apache Tomcat.

This issue affects Apache Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.1, from 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.33, from 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.97.

The mitigation for CVE-2024-50379 was incomplete.

Tomcat 11.0.3, 10.1.35 and 9.0.99 onwards will include checks that sun.io.useCanonCaches is set appropriately before allowing the default servlet to be write enabled on a case insensitive file system. Tomcat will also set sun.io.useCanonCaches to false by default where it can.

References:

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-50379
https://lists.apache.org/thread/b2b9qrgjrz1kvo4ym8y2wkfdvwoq6qbp
https://tomcat.apache.org/
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-56337

CVE-2024-53677(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-20T18:35:12

27 posts

File upload logic is flawed vulnerability in Apache Struts. An attacker can manipulate file upload params to enable paths traversal and under some circumstances this can lead to uploading a malicious file which can be used to perform Remote Code Execution. This issue affects Apache Struts: from 2.0.0 before 6.4.0. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 6.4.0 at least and migrate to the new

8 repos

https://github.com/dustblessnotdust/CVE-2024-53677-S2-067-thread

https://github.com/XiaomingX/CVE-2024-53677-S2-067

https://github.com/cloudwafs/s2-067-CVE-2024-53677

https://github.com/Q0LT/VM-CVE-2024-53677

https://github.com/0xdeviner/CVE-2024-53677

https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-53677-S2-067

https://github.com/c4oocO/CVE-2024-53677-Docker

https://github.com/yangyanglo/CVE-2024-53677

ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-12-25T15:17:27.000Z ##

CVE-2024-53677: A critical file upload vulnerability in Apache Struts2 #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://www.sonatype.com/blog/cve-2024-53677-a-critical-file-upload-vulnerability-in-apache-struts2

##
todb at 2024-12-23T13:52:07.093Z ##

Near as I can tell, the activity around the #Struts2 bug,
CVE-2024-53677, is just ham-handed runs of some generalized PoC, and nobody's actually exploiting this yet (since exploitation would be very application/path specific).

Most of the news last week was all "exploitation happening, patch and rewrite everything now!" but not seeing any reports of successful (or even possibly successful) this morning.

Tell me I'm wrong!

(The PoC identified by SANS at https://isc.sans.edu/diary/31520 isn't specific to some particular application -- it's on the user to define upload_endpoint and assumes no auth or session or anything.)

##

##
ntkramer at 2024-12-18T21:25:56.105Z ##

🎅 & #threatintel: We at @greynoise recently added a tag for Apache Struts2 CVE-2024-53677 regarding unauthenticated file upload attempts. Despite numerous reports of exploitation in the wild, we have not observed any beyond the originally published PoC.

https://viz.greynoise.io/tags/apache-struts2-cve-2024-53677-unauthenticated-file-upload-attempt?days=10
1/2

##
catc0n at 2024-12-18T20:43:59.095Z ##

Almost exactly a year ago, Rapid7 put out a technical analysis of Apache #Struts 2 CVE-2023-50164 that said:

* Exploit payloads were going to need to be customized to the target

* It wasn't clear that there was any critical mass of remotely exploitable applications out of the box

* The reports of exploitation in the wild all appeared to be unsuccessful attempts rather than IRL compromises of production systems.

https://attackerkb.com/topics/pe3CCtOE81/cve-2023-50164/rapid7-analysis

Fast-forward to CVE-2024-53677 and we can repeat the above verbatim, with one pretty notable exception — the "fixed" version that ostensibly remediates the vulnerability actually doesn't, and code-level changes are required (to migrate away from the vulnerable file upload interceptor) to actually remediate it. Also the "fixed" release (6.4.0) appears to have gone out a year ago? No idea. Big ups to @fuzz for the analysis!

https://attackerkb.com/assessments/28f08c0a-702c-4ab0-99cb-eea00202fa2c

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-12-18T17:25:57.000Z ##

On CVE-2024-53677 (Struts vuln), it's following a very similar path to the Struts 2 vuln this time last year:

- Media are reporting it is being exploited in the wild. It isn't. People are spraying and praying - the exploit payloads don't work.

- People are posting a PoC for it. The PoC doesn't work. You'd have to make a vulnerable webapp, and then tailor the PoC to it.

Not to downplay it, just keep calm and patch. You may have noticed the internet didn't melt last time.

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-12-18T16:40:03.000Z ##

CVE-2024-53677 – Des pirates tentent d’exploiter une nouvelle faille critique présente dans Apache Struts ! https://www.it-connect.fr/cve-2024-53677-faille-de-securtie-critique-apache-struts/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité

##
jbhall56 at 2024-12-18T13:48:22.188Z ##

A recently patched critical Apache Struts 2 vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-53677 is actively exploited using public proof-of-concept exploits to find vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-critical-apache-struts-flaw-exploited-to-find-vulnerable-servers/

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-18T09:20:17.000Z ##

ACSC Warns of Remote Code Execution Risk in Apache Struts2

The Australian Cyber Security Center (ACSC) warns of Apache Struts2 CVE-2024-53677, risking remote code execution. Upgrade to Struts 6.4.0 or later.

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/r7ing5

##
Sempf at 2024-12-18T04:58:24.550Z ##

Here's the Struts PoC if anyone wanted to play with it.

https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-53677-S2-067

#struts #poc

##
kurtseifried at 2024-12-18T00:21:16.376Z ##

@jerry

On April thirtieth, two thousand twenty-four,
Apache Struts 2 will be patched no more.
“End of life,” they all said,
“Upgrade now, or you’re dead!”
Yet some left their systems to ignore.

Then came CVE-2024-53677,
A bug that gave hackers their fun.
Through files they did pry,
While admins asked, “Why?”
Too late—the damage was done.

Edit: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-067 explicitly says

Struts 2.0.0 - Struts 2.3.37 (EOL), Struts 2.5.0 - Struts 2.5.33, Struts 6.0.0 - Struts 6.3.0.2

So the 2.5 not being labelled end of life (https://struts.apache.org/struts25-eol-announcement) is gonna be very confusing for a lot of people I suspect.

what-security.co.uk@bsky.brid.gy at 2024-12-17T22:26:40.260Z ##

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-17T18:20:09.000Z ##

New critical Apache Struts flaw exploited to find vulnerable servers

A recently patched critical Apache Struts 2 vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-53677 is actively exploited using public proof-of-concept exploits to...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/pn9p6n

##
ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-12-25T15:17:27.000Z ##

CVE-2024-53677: A critical file upload vulnerability in Apache Struts2 #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://www.sonatype.com/blog/cve-2024-53677-a-critical-file-upload-vulnerability-in-apache-struts2

##
todb@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-23T13:52:07.000Z ##

Near as I can tell, the activity around the #Struts2 bug,
CVE-2024-53677, is just ham-handed runs of some generalized PoC, and nobody's actually exploiting this yet (since exploitation would be very application/path specific).

Most of the news last week was all "exploitation happening, patch and rewrite everything now!" but not seeing any reports of successful (or even possibly successful) this morning.

Tell me I'm wrong!

(The PoC identified by SANS at https://isc.sans.edu/diary/31520 isn't specific to some particular application -- it's on the user to define upload_endpoint and assumes no auth or session or anything.)

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-12-19T04:45:04.000Z ##

Threat actors are attempting to exploit Apache Struts vulnerability CVE-2024-53677 – Source: securityaffairs.com https://ciso2ciso.com/threat-actors-are-attempting-to-exploit-apache-struts-vulnerability-cve-2024-53677-source-securityaffairs-com/ #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #informationsecuritynews #SecurityAffairscom #CyberSecurityNews #PierluigiPaganini #SecurityAffairs #SecurityAffairs #CVE-2024-53677 #ApacheStruts #BreakingNews #SecurityNews #hackingnews #Security #hacking

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-16T22:14:41.000Z ##

CCB (Belgium): WARNING: CRITICAL VULNERABILITY IN APACHE STRUTS, CVE-2024-53677 CAN LEAD TO RCE, PATCH IMMEDIATELY!
The Centre for Cybersecurity Belgium (CCB) goes one step further and says that it's actively exploited. 😑

Update 2024-12-16: PoC exploits have been released and active exploit attempts have been observed that match the PoC exploit code. Also, CVE-2024-53677 appears to be related to a similar, but older, vulnerability CVE-2023-50164 which may not have been completely patched

I'm not sure if this is the real proof of concept for CVE-2024-53677, but here's the link from the Bad Place™️: https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-53677-S2-067

#apache #struts #CVE_2024_53677 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #proofofconcept #poc #eitw #ActiveExploitation #CVE_2023_50164

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-16T22:09:04.000Z ##

CCCS (Canada): Alert - CVE-2024-53677 - Vulnerability impacting Apache Struts 2
I see multiple government organizations emphasize the criticality of CVE-2024-53677 (CVSSv4: 9.5 critical) affecting both end-of-life and current versions of Apache Struts 2. A malicious actor can exploit this vulnerability to traverse system paths, upload malicious files, and perform remote code execution.

The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security (CCCS) is aware that a proof of concept (POC) exploit is available for this CVE.

#apache #struts #CVE_2024_53677 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #proofofconcept #poc

CVE-2024-55956
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 89.13%

updated 2024-12-20T15:21:39.287000

3 posts

In Cleo Harmony before 5.8.0.24, VLTrader before 5.8.0.24, and LexiCom before 5.8.0.24, an unauthenticated user can import and execute arbitrary Bash or PowerShell commands on the host system by leveraging the default settings of the Autorun directory.

Nuclei template

##

CVE-2024-12729
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-20T00:32:18

4 posts

A post-auth SQLi vulnerability in the User Portal allows authenticated users to execute code remotely in Sophos Firewall older than version 21.0 MR1 (21.0.1).

screaminggoat at 2024-12-20T16:02:58.403Z ##

Sophos security advisory 19 December 2024: Resolved Multiple Vulnerabilities in Sophos Firewall (CVE-2024-12727, CVE-2024-12728, CVE-2024-12729)

  • CVE-2024-12727 (9.8 critical) pre-auth SQL injection vulnerability in the email protection feature of Sophos Firewall
  • CVE-2024-12728 (9.8 critical) weak credentials vulnerability potentially allows privileged system access via SSH to Sophos Firewall
  • CVE-2024-12729 (8.8 high) post-auth code injection vulnerability in the User Portal allows authenticated users to execute code remotely in Sophos Firewall

Sophos has not observed these vulnerabilities to be exploited at this time.

#sophos #firewall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
decio at 2024-12-20T09:31:45.161Z ##

Firewall #Sophos : 3 #vulnerabilites critiques corrigées (CVE-2024-12727, CVE-2024-12728, CVE-2024-12729)

CVE-2024-12727 (Critique)
Une vulnérabilité d'injection SQL pré-authentification dans la fonctionnalité de protection email.

Impact : Risque d'exécution de code à distance (RCE) si certaines configurations spécifiques (SPX activé + mode HA) sont en place.
Découverte : Signalée par un chercheur externe via le programme de bug bounty Sophos.

CVE-2024-12728 (Critique)
Un mot de passe SSH suggéré et non-aléatoire pour l'initialisation de clusters HA peut rester actif après déploiement.

Impact : Exposition d'un compte système privilégié si SSH est activé.
Découverte : Détection interne par Sophos.

CVE-2024-12729 (Haut)
Injection de code post-authentification via le Portail Utilisateur.

Impact : Utilisateurs authentifiés peuvent exécuter du code à distance.
Découverte : Signalée par un chercheur externe via le programme de bug bounty Sophos.

📌 Correctifs et recommandations :

Hotfixes disponibles : Appliqués automatiquement si l'option d'installation automatique est activée (paramètre par défaut).

Versions affectées : Sophos Firewall v21.0 GA et versions antérieures.

Remédiation : Vérifiez que vous utilisez une version corrigée ou mettez à jour vers la dernière version compatible (v21 MR1 ou plus récent).

🔒 Mesures de protection:

Désactiver l'accès WAN au Portail Utilisateur et à Webadmin : Utilisez des VPN ou Sophos Central pour la gestion à distance.

Restreindre l'accès SSH :
Limiter aux ports HA dédiés, physiquement séparés.
Reconfigurer HA avec une passphrase aléatoire et suffisamment longue.

"Sophos has not observed these vulnerabilities to be exploited at this time."
👇
https://www.sophos.com/en-us/security-advisories/sophos-sa-20241219-sfos-rce

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_12727 #CVE_2024_12728 #CVE-2024-12729

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-20T16:02:58.000Z ##

Sophos security advisory 19 December 2024: Resolved Multiple Vulnerabilities in Sophos Firewall (CVE-2024-12727, CVE-2024-12728, CVE-2024-12729)

  • CVE-2024-12727 (9.8 critical) pre-auth SQL injection vulnerability in the email protection feature of Sophos Firewall
  • CVE-2024-12728 (9.8 critical) weak credentials vulnerability potentially allows privileged system access via SSH to Sophos Firewall
  • CVE-2024-12729 (8.8 high) post-auth code injection vulnerability in the User Portal allows authenticated users to execute code remotely in Sophos Firewall

Sophos has not observed these vulnerabilities to be exploited at this time.

#sophos #firewall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-20T09:31:45.000Z ##

Firewall #Sophos : 3 #vulnerabilites critiques corrigées (CVE-2024-12727, CVE-2024-12728, CVE-2024-12729)

CVE-2024-12727 (Critique)
Une vulnérabilité d'injection SQL pré-authentification dans la fonctionnalité de protection email.

Impact : Risque d'exécution de code à distance (RCE) si certaines configurations spécifiques (SPX activé + mode HA) sont en place.
Découverte : Signalée par un chercheur externe via le programme de bug bounty Sophos.

CVE-2024-12728 (Critique)
Un mot de passe SSH suggéré et non-aléatoire pour l'initialisation de clusters HA peut rester actif après déploiement.

Impact : Exposition d'un compte système privilégié si SSH est activé.
Découverte : Détection interne par Sophos.

CVE-2024-12729 (Haut)
Injection de code post-authentification via le Portail Utilisateur.

Impact : Utilisateurs authentifiés peuvent exécuter du code à distance.
Découverte : Signalée par un chercheur externe via le programme de bug bounty Sophos.

📌 Correctifs et recommandations :

Hotfixes disponibles : Appliqués automatiquement si l'option d'installation automatique est activée (paramètre par défaut).

Versions affectées : Sophos Firewall v21.0 GA et versions antérieures.

Remédiation : Vérifiez que vous utilisez une version corrigée ou mettez à jour vers la dernière version compatible (v21 MR1 ou plus récent).

🔒 Mesures de protection:

Désactiver l'accès WAN au Portail Utilisateur et à Webadmin : Utilisez des VPN ou Sophos Central pour la gestion à distance.

Restreindre l'accès SSH :
Limiter aux ports HA dédiés, physiquement séparés.
Reconfigurer HA avec une passphrase aléatoire et suffisamment longue.

"Sophos has not observed these vulnerabilities to be exploited at this time."
👇
https://www.sophos.com/en-us/security-advisories/sophos-sa-20241219-sfos-rce

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_12727 #CVE_2024_12728 #CVE-2024-12729

##

CVE-2024-12727
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T21:31:22

4 posts

A pre-auth SQL injection vulnerability in the email protection feature of Sophos Firewall versions older than 21.0 MR1 (21.0.1) allows access to the reporting database and can lead to remote code execution if a specific configuration of Secure PDF eXchange (SPX) is enabled in combination with the firewall running in High Availability (HA) mode.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-20T16:02:58.403Z ##

Sophos security advisory 19 December 2024: Resolved Multiple Vulnerabilities in Sophos Firewall (CVE-2024-12727, CVE-2024-12728, CVE-2024-12729)

  • CVE-2024-12727 (9.8 critical) pre-auth SQL injection vulnerability in the email protection feature of Sophos Firewall
  • CVE-2024-12728 (9.8 critical) weak credentials vulnerability potentially allows privileged system access via SSH to Sophos Firewall
  • CVE-2024-12729 (8.8 high) post-auth code injection vulnerability in the User Portal allows authenticated users to execute code remotely in Sophos Firewall

Sophos has not observed these vulnerabilities to be exploited at this time.

#sophos #firewall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
decio at 2024-12-20T09:31:45.161Z ##

Firewall #Sophos : 3 #vulnerabilites critiques corrigées (CVE-2024-12727, CVE-2024-12728, CVE-2024-12729)

CVE-2024-12727 (Critique)
Une vulnérabilité d'injection SQL pré-authentification dans la fonctionnalité de protection email.

Impact : Risque d'exécution de code à distance (RCE) si certaines configurations spécifiques (SPX activé + mode HA) sont en place.
Découverte : Signalée par un chercheur externe via le programme de bug bounty Sophos.

CVE-2024-12728 (Critique)
Un mot de passe SSH suggéré et non-aléatoire pour l'initialisation de clusters HA peut rester actif après déploiement.

Impact : Exposition d'un compte système privilégié si SSH est activé.
Découverte : Détection interne par Sophos.

CVE-2024-12729 (Haut)
Injection de code post-authentification via le Portail Utilisateur.

Impact : Utilisateurs authentifiés peuvent exécuter du code à distance.
Découverte : Signalée par un chercheur externe via le programme de bug bounty Sophos.

📌 Correctifs et recommandations :

Hotfixes disponibles : Appliqués automatiquement si l'option d'installation automatique est activée (paramètre par défaut).

Versions affectées : Sophos Firewall v21.0 GA et versions antérieures.

Remédiation : Vérifiez que vous utilisez une version corrigée ou mettez à jour vers la dernière version compatible (v21 MR1 ou plus récent).

🔒 Mesures de protection:

Désactiver l'accès WAN au Portail Utilisateur et à Webadmin : Utilisez des VPN ou Sophos Central pour la gestion à distance.

Restreindre l'accès SSH :
Limiter aux ports HA dédiés, physiquement séparés.
Reconfigurer HA avec une passphrase aléatoire et suffisamment longue.

"Sophos has not observed these vulnerabilities to be exploited at this time."
👇
https://www.sophos.com/en-us/security-advisories/sophos-sa-20241219-sfos-rce

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_12727 #CVE_2024_12728 #CVE-2024-12729

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-20T16:02:58.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-12728 (9.8 critical) weak credentials vulnerability potentially allows privileged system access via SSH to Sophos Firewall
  • CVE-2024-12729 (8.8 high) post-auth code injection vulnerability in the User Portal allows authenticated users to execute code remotely in Sophos Firewall

Sophos has not observed these vulnerabilities to be exploited at this time.

(9.8 CRITICAL)

updated 2024-12-19T21:31:22

4 posts

CVE-2024-56145(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T20:13:02

4 posts

### Impact You are affected if your php.ini configuration has `register_argc_argv` enabled. ### Patches Update to 3.9.14, 4.13.2, or 5.5.2. ### Workarounds If you can't upgrade yet, and `register_argc_argv` is enabled, you can disable it to mitigate the issue.

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-56145

https://github.com/Sachinart/CVE-2024-56145-craftcms-rce

CVE-2021-26102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T15:31:16

2 posts

A relative path traversal vulnerability (CWE-23) in FortiWAN version 4.5.7 and below, 4.4 all versions may allow a remote non-authenticated attacker to delete files on the system by sending a crafted POST request. In particular, deleting specific configuration files will reset the Admin password to its default value.

CVE-2024-51479
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T15:04:24

2 posts

### Impact If a Next.js application is performing authorization in middleware based on pathname, it was possible for this authorization to be bypassed. ### Patches This issue was patched in Next.js `14.2.15` and later. If your Next.js application is hosted on Vercel, this vulnerability has been automatically mitigated, regardless of Next.js version. ### Workarounds There are no official workaro

mttaggart at 2024-12-20T04:52:16.975Z ##

Wow, a fairly serious auth bypass in Next.js, a super popular frontend framework:

If a Next.js application is performing authorization in middleware based on pathname, it was possible for this authorization to be bypassed.

https://securityonline.info/cve-2024-51479-next-js-authorization-bypass-vulnerability-affects-millions-of-developers/

(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T12:32:50

2 posts

Incorrect authorization vulnerability in HTTP POST method in Govee Home application on Android and iOS allows remote attacker to control devices owned by other users via changing "device", "sku" and "type" fields' values.  This issue affects Govee Home applications on Android and iOS in versions before 5.9.

CVE-2020-12819
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T09:30:48

2 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the processing of Link Control Protocol messages in FortiGate versions 5.6.12, 6.0.10, 6.2.4 and 6.4.1 and earlier may allow a remote attacker with valid SSL VPN credentials to crash the SSL VPN daemon by sending a large LCP packet, when tunnel mode is enabled. Arbitrary code execution may be theoretically possible, albeit practically very difficult to

cR0w at 2024-12-19T21:28:41.491Z ##

And another delayed one from Fortinet. CVE-2020-12819 was published today: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-12819

But the Fortinet advisory was published 24 September 2020: https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-20-082

A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the processing of Link Control Protocol messages in FortiOS may allow a remote attacker with valid SSL VPN credentials to crash the SSL VPN daemon by sending a large LCP packet, when tunnel mode is enabled. Arbitrary code execution may be theoretically possible, albeit practically very difficult to achieve in this context.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-19T21:28:41.000Z ##

And another delayed one from Fortinet. CVE-2020-12819 was published today: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-12819

But the Fortinet advisory was published 24 September 2020: https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-20-082

A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the processing of Link Control Protocol messages in FortiOS may allow a remote attacker with valid SSL VPN credentials to crash the SSL VPN daemon by sending a large LCP packet, when tunnel mode is enabled. Arbitrary code execution may be theoretically possible, albeit practically very difficult to achieve in this context.

CVE-2024-12692(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T00:37:42

2 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 131.0.6778.204 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-12-18T22:16:24.116Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 18 December 2024: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New version 131.0.6778.204/.205 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.204 for Linux contains 5 security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-12692 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-12693 (high) Out of bounds memory access in V8
  • CVE-2024-12694 (high) Use after free in Compositing
  • CVE-2024-12695 (high) Out of bounds write in V8

No mention of exploitation

#google #chrome #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T22:16:24.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 18 December 2024: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New version 131.0.6778.204/.205 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.204 for Linux contains 5 security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-12692 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-12693 (high) Out of bounds memory access in V8
  • CVE-2024-12694 (high) Use after free in Compositing
  • CVE-2024-12695 (high) Out of bounds write in V8

No mention of exploitation

##

CVE-2024-12695(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-19T00:37:42

2 posts

Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 131.0.6778.204 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-12-18T22:16:24.116Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 18 December 2024: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New version 131.0.6778.204/.205 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.204 for Linux contains 5 security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-12692 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-12693 (high) Out of bounds memory access in V8
  • CVE-2024-12694 (high) Use after free in Compositing
  • CVE-2024-12695 (high) Out of bounds write in V8

No mention of exploitation

#google #chrome #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T22:16:24.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 18 December 2024: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New version 131.0.6778.204/.205 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.204 for Linux contains 5 security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-12692 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-12693 (high) Out of bounds memory access in V8
  • CVE-2024-12694 (high) Use after free in Compositing
  • CVE-2024-12695 (high) Out of bounds write in V8

No mention of exploitation

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-18T21:59:48

2 posts

An attacker can craft an input to the Parse functions that would be processed non-linearly with respect to its length, resulting in extremely slow parsing. This could cause a denial of service.

##

CVE-2024-12686
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-18T21:31:03

2 posts

A vulnerability has been discovered in Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) which can allow an attacker with existing administrative privileges to inject commands and run as a site user.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-19T17:22:22.071Z ##

BeyondTrust: BeyondTrust Remote Support SaaS Service Security Investigation
Apparently BeyondTrust discovered the vulnerabilities CVE-2024-12356 (see parent toot above) as well as CVE-2024-12686 (6.6 medium, disclosed 18 December 2024) Command Injection vulnerability in Remote Support(RS) & Privilege Remote Access (PRA) while investigating a security breach that occurred in Remote Support SaaS instances on or about 05 December 2024. Currently unknown if these vulnerabilities were exploited. Indicators of compromise are shared.

h/t Bleeping Computer for the information: BeyondTrust says hackers breached Remote Support SaaS instances

EDIT: There are indications that CVE-2024-12356 may have been exploited.

#IOC #threatintel #CVE #CVE_2024_12356 #CVE_2024_12686 #beyondtrust #dfir #infosec #cybersecurity #vulnerability #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-19T17:22:22.000Z ##

BeyondTrust: BeyondTrust Remote Support SaaS Service Security Investigation
Apparently BeyondTrust discovered the vulnerabilities CVE-2024-12356 (see parent toot above) as well as CVE-2024-12686 (6.6 medium, disclosed 18 December 2024) Command Injection vulnerability in Remote Support(RS) & Privilege Remote Access (PRA) while investigating a security breach that occurred in Remote Support SaaS instances on or about 05 December 2024. Currently unknown if these vulnerabilities were exploited. Indicators of compromise are shared.

h/t Bleeping Computer for the information: BeyondTrust says hackers breached Remote Support SaaS instances

EDIT: There are indications that CVE-2024-12356 may have been exploited.

CVE-2022-23227
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 26.29%

updated 2024-12-18T21:30:49

4 posts

NUUO NVRmini2 through 3.11 allows an unauthenticated attacker to upload an encrypted TAR archive, which can be abused to add arbitrary users because of the lack of handle_import_user.php authentication. When combined with another flaw (CVE-2011-5325), it is possible to overwrite arbitrary files under the web root and achieve code execution as root.

##

CVE-2024-21547
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-18T15:48:26

2 posts

Versions of the package spatie/browsershot before 5.0.2 are vulnerable to Directory Traversal due to URI normalisation in the browser where the file:// check can be bypassed with file:\\. An attacker could read any file on the server by exploiting the normalization of \ into /.

cR0w at 2024-12-18T18:57:48.013Z ##

Since it's already a ../ kind of day, how about another one in browsershot?

https://github.com/spatie/browsershot/commit/dfc3635b83dd980e5c39f8f8c73e87723b99ca01

Edit to add the NVD link: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21547

This one is fun because the protocol checks only looked for file:// and could be bypassed by using file:\\.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T18:57:48.000Z ##

Since it's already a ../ kind of day, how about another one in browsershot?

https://github.com/spatie/browsershot/commit/dfc3635b83dd980e5c39f8f8c73e87723b99ca01

Edit to add the NVD link: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21547

This one is fun because the protocol checks only looked for file:// and could be bypassed by using file:\\.

CVE-2023-34990
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-18T15:33:05

30 posts

A relative path traversal in Fortinet FortiWLM version 8.6.0 through 8.6.5 and 8.5.0 through 8.5.4 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted web requests.

jbhall56 at 2024-12-19T13:45:05.517Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2023-34990, carries a CVSS score of 9.6 out of a maximum of 10.0. https://thehackernews.com/2024/12/fortinet-warns-of-critical-fortiwlm.html

##
mttaggart at 2024-12-18T22:27:43.537Z ##

I think it was @SecurityWriter 's poll about worst org of the year that had Fortinet losing badly to Crowdstrike and Ivanti. But my faith has been rewarded: they will never miss a rake to step on.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-34990

##
cR0w at 2024-12-18T21:22:38.276Z ##

According to a web search, if you had a child born on the day CVE-2023-34990 was reported to Fortinet, they would likely be able to climb stairs and throw a ball by now.

##
cR0w at 2024-12-18T21:05:15.934Z ##

Five hundred eighty-five days. That's how long ago CVE-2023-34990 was reported to Fortinet. Since then, 12 May 2023, Fortinet has had 15 other directory traversal CVEs published. That's how long ago that was.

Edit to fix typo in CVE number.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-18T18:20:30.843Z ##

CVE-2023-34990 is credited to @hacks_zach of Horizon3.ai. This gave me a starting point for figuring out where to look for information. It's contained in Fortinet FortiWLM Deep-Dive, IOCs, and the Almost Story of the “Forti Forty” posted on 14 March 2024.

It was described as an unpatched vulnerability: "Unauthenticated Limited Log File Read – Allows retrieval of arbitrary log files which contain administrator session ID tokens" Check out the Path to Remote Code Execution #2 section for vulnerability details:

This vulnerability allows remote, unauthenticated attackers to access and abuse builtin functionality meant to read specific log files on the system via a crafted request to the /ems/cgi-bin/ezrf_lighttpd.cgi endpoint. This issue results from the lack of input validation on request parameters allowing an attacker to traverse directories and read any log file on the system.

Based on the details of the blog, I can confidently say that the new CVE and the blog's description of the vulnerability are almost certainly one and the same. Timeline puts the reporting at 585 days ago.

#CVE_2023_34990 #fortinet #fortiwlm #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

cR0w at 2024-12-18T18:12:18.981Z ##

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-18T17:03:05.793Z ##

@jerry Here are sources for your Fortinet CVE-2024-34990 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical):

  • https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-144 (error loading)
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-34990

A relative path traversal in Fortinet FortiWLM version 8.6.0 through 8.6.5 and 8.5.0 through 8.5.4 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted web requests.

Note: FortiGuard PSIRT has a tendency to only list the temporal CVSS score 9.6 (lower score) to downplay the severity of its original base score.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-18T16:34:19.772Z ##

Fortinet 18 December 2024 security advisory FG-IR-23-144
CVE-2023-34990 (9.8 critical) relative path traversal in Fortinet FortiWLM leads to code and command execution: released today, 557 days after it was reserved by Fortinet on 09 June 2023. Information in advisory doesn't match what was submitted to NVD. CVSS score is also different than what's listed (base vs temporal score. Shame on them for waiting a year to patch/announce the vulnerability.

h/t: @cR0w

#fortinet #fortwlm #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
cR0w at 2024-12-18T14:01:58.491Z ##

If you're going to assign a CVE but then wait a whole year to publish it, please make sure the PSIRT link in the CVE goes somewhere so people can get some some official info to pass along. This is especially important when it's a sev:CRIT directory traversal vuln because the meme is strong this year. yells in ../

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-34990

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T21:05:15.000Z ##

Five hundred eighty-five days. That's how long ago CVE-2023-34990 was reported to Fortinet. Since then, 12 May 2023, Fortinet has had 15 other directory traversal CVEs published. That's how long ago that was.

Edit to fix typo in CVE number.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T18:20:30.000Z ##

CVE-2023-34990 is credited to @hacks_zach of Horizon3.ai. This gave me a starting point for figuring out where to look for information. It's contained in Fortinet FortiWLM Deep-Dive, IOCs, and the Almost Story of the “Forti Forty” posted on 14 March 2024.

It was described as an unpatched vulnerability: "Unauthenticated Limited Log File Read – Allows retrieval of arbitrary log files which contain administrator session ID tokens" Check out the Path to Remote Code Execution #2 section for vulnerability details:

This vulnerability allows remote, unauthenticated attackers to access and abuse builtin functionality meant to read specific log files on the system via a crafted request to the /ems/cgi-bin/ezrf_lighttpd.cgi endpoint. This issue results from the lack of input validation on request parameters allowing an attacker to traverse directories and read any log file on the system.

Based on the details of the blog, I can confidently say that the new CVE and the blog's description of the vulnerability are almost certainly one and the same. Timeline puts the reporting at 585 days ago.

#CVE_2023_34990 #fortinet #fortiwlm #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T18:12:18.000Z ##

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T17:03:05.000Z ##

@jerry Here are sources for your Fortinet CVE-2024-34990 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical):

  • https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-144 (error loading)
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-34990

A relative path traversal in Fortinet FortiWLM version 8.6.0 through 8.6.5 and 8.5.0 through 8.5.4 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted web requests.

Note: FortiGuard PSIRT has a tendency to only list the temporal CVSS score 9.6 (lower score) to downplay the severity of its original base score.

Vendor: BeyondTrust
Product: Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS)

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Very hot! 🥵 Page isn't live yet (access denied), but it's BeyondTrust CVE-2024-12356 (see parent toots above)

NOTE THE DUE DATE!! This is a very important vulnerability to CISA!

#beyondtrust #cisa #kev #cve #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-19T17:22:22.071Z ##

BeyondTrust: BeyondTrust Remote Support SaaS Service Security Investigation
Apparently BeyondTrust discovered the vulnerabilities CVE-2024-12356 (see parent toot above) as well as CVE-2024-12686 (6.6 medium, disclosed 18 December 2024) Command Injection vulnerability in Remote Support(RS) & Privilege Remote Access (PRA) while investigating a security breach that occurred in Remote Support SaaS instances on or about 05 December 2024. Currently unknown if these vulnerabilities were exploited. Indicators of compromise are shared.

h/t Bleeping Computer for the information: BeyondTrust says hackers breached Remote Support SaaS instances

EDIT: There are indications that CVE-2024-12356 may have been exploited.

#IOC #threatintel #CVE #CVE_2024_12356 #CVE_2024_12686 #beyondtrust #dfir #infosec #cybersecurity #vulnerability #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

screaminggoat at 2024-12-24T20:47:49.933Z ##

@deepthoughts10 they got mad at Rapid7 this year during the coordinated vulnerability disclosure of CVE-2024-27198 and CVE-2024-27198:

  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/
  • https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/
  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/

JetBrains' stance on vulnerabilities is silent patching.

CVE-2024-11053
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-11T15:32:23

2 posts

When asked to both use a `.netrc` file for credentials and to follow HTTP redirects, curl could leak the password used for the first host to the followed-to host under certain circumstances. This flaw only manifests itself if the netrc file has an entry that matches the redirect target hostname but the entry either omits just the password or omits both login and password.

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-12-23T08:46:55.000Z ##

Got a rewrite of the #curl CVE-2024-11053 security advisory submitted as a new issue on Hackerone this morning. Using parts of the same wording. That I wrote.

People.

@westonsteimel easiest is to hit the KEV team up at KEV@cisa.dhs.gov.

Right now, KEV says that CVE-2024-50623 is CVE-434 (so sayeth https://www.cisa.gov/sites/default/files/feeds/known_exploited_vulnerabilities.json )

This appears to match the CISA-ADP value seen at https://www.cve.org/cverecord?id=CVE-2024-50623

And I'm not seeing any obvious errors with my parsing eyeballs. Any errors you're seeing, hit us up in email!

SolarWinds security advisory 10 December 2024 SolarWinds Web Help Desk Local File Read Vulnerability (CVE-2024-45709)
CVE-2024-45709 (5.3 medium) SolarWinds Web Help Desk was susceptible to a local file read vulnerability. This vulnerability requires the software be installed on Linux and configured to use non-default development/test mode making exposure to the vulnerability very limited. No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-21455
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-16T21:32:11

1 posts

Memory corruption when a compat IOCTL call is followed by another IOCTL call from userspace to a driver.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-16T16:32:27.000Z ##

Google Project Zero: The Qualcomm DSP Driver - Unexpectedly Excavating an Exploit
This blog post is a companion piece to Amnesty International's report (see parent toot above): a technical analysis of kernel panic logs generated by an in-the-wild (ITW) exploit, which led to the discovery of 6 vulnerabilities in a Qualcomm driver (one noted by Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) as exploited in the wild). This blog post covers the details of the original artifacts, each of the bugs discovered, and the hypothesized ITW exploit strategy gleaned from the logs. Vulnerabilities explicitly mentioned are CVE-2024-38402, CVE-2024-21455, CVE-2024-33060, CVE-2024-49848, and CVE-2024-43047 (KEV). The Project Zero post ends with a rebuke of Qualcomm for not patching vulnerabilities under the industry standard 90 day deadline, with 49848 still being unfixed 145 days after being reported. "Past research has shown that chipset drivers for Android are a promising target for attackers, and this ITW exploit represents a meaningful real-world example of the negative ramifications that the current third-party vendor driver security posture poses to end-users"

#serbia #spyware #cellebrite #humanrights #privacy #zeroday #vulnerability #bia #novispy #spyware #infosec #cyberthreatintelligence #cybersecurity #CTI #qualcomm

##

https://codebook.machinarecord.com/threatreport/36505/

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-16T16:32:27.000Z ##

"Past research has shown that chipset drivers for Android are a promising target for attackers, and this ITW exploit represents a meaningful real-world example of the negative ramifications that the current third-party vendor driver security posture poses to end-users"

CVE-2024-6386
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-09-27T13:25:43.077000

1 posts

The WPML plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution in all versions up to, and including, 4.6.12 via the Twig Server-Side Template Injection. This is due to missing input validation and sanitization on the render function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to execute code on the server.

CVE-2024-7348
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-08T15:31:31

2 posts

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition in pg_dump in PostgreSQL allows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the user running pg_dump, which is often a superuser. The attack involves replacing another relation type with a view or foreign table. The attack requires waiting for pg_dump to start, but winning the race condition is trivial if the attacker retains an open tr

@jerry Here are sources for your Fortinet CVE-2024-34990 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical):

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-34990

A relative path traversal in Fortinet FortiWLM version 8.6.0 through 8.6.5 and 8.5.0 through 8.5.4 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted web requests.

Note: FortiGuard PSIRT has a tendency to only list the temporal CVSS score 9.6 (lower score) to downplay the severity of its original base score.

(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 95.56%

updated 2024-07-25T15:31:37

2 posts

Equation Editor in Microsoft Office 2007, Microsoft Office 2010, Microsoft Office 2013, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow a remote code execution vulnerability due to the way objects are handled in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE is unique from CVE-2018-0797 and CVE-2018-0812.

EPSS: 95.05%

updated 2024-07-03T18:32:21

2 posts

The D-Link DIR-645 Wired/Wireless Router Rev. Ax with firmware 1.04b12 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a GetDeviceSettings action to the HNAP interface.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-26T20:36:58.868Z ##

Fortinet: Botnets Continue to Target Aging D-Link Vulnerabilities
The fun don't stop with end-of-life D-Link products: Botnets like FICORA, a Mirai variant, and CAPSAICIN, a Kaiten variant, are exploiting CVE-2015-2051, CVE-2019-10891, CVE-2022-37056, and CVE-2024-33112. Only CVE-2015-2051 is in CISA's KEV Catalog. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #botnet #mirai #kaiten #ddos #capsaicin #ficora #dlink #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #IOC

screaminggoat at 2024-12-24T20:47:49.933Z ##

@deepthoughts10 they got mad at Rapid7 this year during the coordinated vulnerability disclosure of CVE-2024-27198 and CVE-2024-27198:

  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/
  • https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/
  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/

JetBrains' stance on vulnerabilities is silent patching.

##

  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/

JetBrains' stance on vulnerabilities is silent patching.

CVE-2024-20767
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.39%

updated 2024-03-18T12:31:54

9 posts

ColdFusion versions 2023.6, 2021.12 and earlier are affected by an Improper Access Control vulnerability that could lead to arbitrary file system read. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass security measures and gain unauthorized access to sensitive files and perform arbitrary file system write. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

Nuclei template

4 repos

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2024-20767

https://github.com/m-cetin/CVE-2024-20767

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-20767

https://github.com/Praison001/CVE-2024-20767-Adobe-ColdFusion

screaminggoat at 2024-12-24T02:09:41.118Z ##

Adobe zero-day: APSB24-107 Security updates available for Adobe ColdFusion
CVE-2024-53961 (7.4 high) Adobe ColdFusion arbitrary file system read

Adobe is aware that CVE-2024-53961 has a known proof-of-concept that could cause an arbitrary file system read.

If you want vulnerability details, the reporter ma4ter previously reported on a similar Adobe ColdFusion Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability CVE-2024-20767 🤔

EDIT: Additional details: It's CWE-22 (Path Traversal), and Adobe considers it a Priority 1 (vulnerability being targeted or higher risk of being targeted)

#adobe #zeroday #vulnerability #cve_2024_53961 #cve #infosec #proofofconcept #CVE_2024_20767 #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2023-50164
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 53.31%

updated 2023-12-18T20:35:59

3 posts

An attacker can manipulate file upload params to enable paths traversal and under some circumstances this can lead to uploading a malicious file which can be used to perform Remote Code Execution. Users are recommended to upgrade to versions Struts 2.5.33 or Struts 6.3.0.2 or greater to fix this issue.

14 repos

https://github.com/aaronm-sysdig/cve-2023-50164

https://github.com/dwisiswant0/cve-2023-50164-poc

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2023-50164-Apache-Struts-RCE

https://github.com/Thirukrishnan/CVE-2023-50164-Apache-Struts-RCE

catc0n at 2024-12-18T20:43:59.095Z ##

Almost exactly a year ago, Rapid7 put out a technical analysis of Apache #Struts 2 CVE-2023-50164 that said:

* Exploit payloads were going to need to be customized to the target

* It wasn't clear that there was any critical mass of remotely exploitable applications out of the box

* The reports of exploitation in the wild all appeared to be unsuccessful attempts rather than IRL compromises of production systems.

https://attackerkb.com/topics/pe3CCtOE81/cve-2023-50164/rapid7-analysis

Fast-forward to CVE-2024-53677 and we can repeat the above verbatim, with one pretty notable exception — the "fixed" version that ostensibly remediates the vulnerability actually doesn't, and code-level changes are required (to migrate away from the vulnerable file upload interceptor) to actually remediate it. Also the "fixed" release (6.4.0) appears to have gone out a year ago? No idea. Big ups to @fuzz for the analysis!

https://attackerkb.com/assessments/28f08c0a-702c-4ab0-99cb-eea00202fa2c

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-18T20:43:59.000Z ##

Almost exactly a year ago, Rapid7 put out a technical analysis of Apache #Struts 2 CVE-2023-50164 that said:

* Exploit payloads were going to need to be customized to the target

* It wasn't clear that there was any critical mass of remotely exploitable applications out of the box

* The reports of exploitation in the wild all appeared to be unsuccessful attempts rather than IRL compromises of production systems.

https://attackerkb.com/topics/pe3CCtOE81/cve-2023-50164/rapid7-analysis

Fast-forward to CVE-2024-53677 and we can repeat the above verbatim, with one pretty notable exception — the "fixed" version that ostensibly remediates the vulnerability actually doesn't, and code-level changes are required (to migrate away from the vulnerable file upload interceptor) to actually remediate it. Also the "fixed" release (6.4.0) appears to have gone out a year ago? No idea. Big ups to @fuzz for the analysis!

https://attackerkb.com/assessments/28f08c0a-702c-4ab0-99cb-eea00202fa2c

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-16T22:14:41.000Z ##

CCB (Belgium): WARNING: CRITICAL VULNERABILITY IN APACHE STRUTS, CVE-2024-53677 CAN LEAD TO RCE, PATCH IMMEDIATELY!
The Centre for Cybersecurity Belgium (CCB) goes one step further and says that it's actively exploited. 😑

Update 2024-12-16: PoC exploits have been released and active exploit attempts have been observed that match the PoC exploit code. Also, CVE-2024-53677 appears to be related to a similar, but older, vulnerability CVE-2023-50164 which may not have been completely patched

I'm not sure if this is the real proof of concept for CVE-2024-53677, but here's the link from the Bad Place™️: https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-53677-S2-067

#apache #struts #CVE_2024_53677 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #proofofconcept #poc #eitw #ActiveExploitation #CVE_2023_50164

##

CVE-2021-40407
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 3.08%

updated 2023-02-03T05:05:34

7 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability exists in the device network settings functionality of reolink RLC-410W v3.0.0.136_20121102. At [1] or [2], based on DDNS type, the ddns->domain variable, that has the value of the domain parameter provided through the SetDdns API, is not validated properly. This would lead to an OS command injection. An attacker can send an HTTP request to trigger this vulner

hrbrmstr.dev@bsky.brid.gy at 2024-12-28T13:33:11.000Z ##

CVE-2017-7407
(2.4 LOW)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2023-02-02T05:01:27

2 posts

The ourWriteOut function in tool_writeout.c in curl 7.53.1 might allow physically proximate attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory in opportunistic circumstances by reading a workstation screen during use of a --write-out argument ending in a '%' character, which leads to a heap-based buffer over-read.

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-12-18T08:41:17.000Z ##

I just love how someone dives down through history and thinks they found a mistake in which commit that introduced the #curl CVE-2017-7407 ....

https://curl.se/mail/lib-2024-12/0024.html

##

CVE-2016-9594
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.85%

updated 2023-02-01T05:08:57

2 posts

curl before version 7.52.1 is vulnerable to an uninitialized random in libcurl's internal function that returns a good 32bit random value. Having a weak or virtually non-existent random value makes the operations that use it vulnerable.

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-12-23T10:34:11.000Z ##

Eight years ago on this date, I had to publicly share this #curl security advisory as perhaps one of my lamest mistakes ever: https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2016-9594.html

We learn from our mistakes. Hopefully.

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-12-23T10:34:11.000Z ##

screaminggoat at 2024-12-26T20:36:58.868Z ##

Fortinet: Botnets Continue to Target Aging D-Link Vulnerabilities
The fun don't stop with end-of-life D-Link products: Botnets like FICORA, a Mirai variant, and CAPSAICIN, a Kaiten variant, are exploiting CVE-2015-2051, CVE-2019-10891, CVE-2022-37056, and CVE-2024-33112. Only CVE-2015-2051 is in CISA's KEV Catalog. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #botnet #mirai #kaiten #ddos #capsaicin #ficora #dlink #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #IOC

CVE-2021-20023
(4.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 93.33%

updated 2023-01-27T05:03:14

6 posts

SonicWall Email Security version 10.0.9.x contains a vulnerability that allows a post-authenticated attacker to read an arbitrary file on the remote host.

cR0w at 2024-12-19T18:47:19.847Z ##

@screaminggoat Heh. It's an old one and listed as already used by ransomware so I figured people should already have that one noted.

But I show it as 4.9 per NIST with a vector of CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-20023

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-19T18:41:35.578Z ##

@cR0w you gonna drop a CVE and make me work for the context? :blobtongue:

SonicWall's security advisory actually scores CVE-2021-20023 higher at 6.7 medium using the v3.0 vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:L/A:H. Here is SonicWall's actual zero-day product notification, which links to FireEye (now Mandiant, part of Google Cloud): Zero-Day Exploits in SonicWall Email Security Lead to Enterprise Compromise

Combinations of all three exploits were leveraged interchangeably by the adversary to perform the following actions:

  1. Creation of a new Administrator account on the SonicWall ES device
  2. Exposure of the hashed passwords for existing, locally configured Administrative accounts
  3. The creation of a web shell in an arbitrary directory
  4. Real-time debugging of exploitation success and failure

Now THIS is the context of CVE-2021-20023. It really is about how an attacker leverages the vulnerability and not the CVSS score.

##
cR0w at 2024-12-19T18:29:37.916Z ##

Here's another fun ../ stat: There are currently 25 directory traversal CVEs in the CISA KEV catalog. One of them ( CVE-2021-20023 ) has a CVSS score of 4.9 . Point being that CVSS scores are a nice metric and all, especially for BINGO cards and such, but please read the actual write-ups. That will give you so much more context than the silly, often inaccurate numbers.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-19T18:47:19.000Z ##

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-20023

Here is SonicWall's actual zero-day product notification, which links to FireEye (now Mandiant, part of Google Cloud): Zero-Day Exploits in SonicWall Email Security Lead to Enterprise Compromise

  1. Creation of a new Administrator account on the SonicWall ES device
  2. Exposure of the hashed passwords for existing, locally configured Administrative accounts

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-19T18:29:37.000Z ##

Here's another fun ../ stat: There are currently 25 directory traversal CVEs in the CISA KEV catalog. One of them ( CVE-2021-20023 ) has a CVSS score of 4.9 . Point being that CVSS scores are a nice metric and all, especially for BINGO cards and such, but please read the actual write-ups. That will give you so much more context than the silly, often inaccurate numbers.

geeknik at 2024-12-28T04:43:57.654Z ##

CVE-1945-0001: First documented instance of arbitrary code execution on electronic hardware.

Impact: CRITICAL.
Vector: Manual input.
Mitigation: None - all modern computing inherits this 'vulnerability' by design.

We are all Von Neumann machines now.
https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/356580.356581

##
geeknik@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-28T04:43:57.000Z ##

CVE-1945-0001: First documented instance of arbitrary code execution on electronic hardware.

##

CVE-2024-56732
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2024-12-27T21:19:47.324Z ##

Critical overflow in HarfBuzz which TIL:

HarfBuzz is a text shaping engine. It primarily supports OpenType, but also Apple Advanced Typography. HarfBuzz is used in Android, Chrome, ChromeOS, Firefox, GNOME, GTK+, KDE, Qt, LibreOffice, OpenJDK, XeTeX, PlayStation, Microsoft Edge, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Godot Engine, Unreal Engine, and other places.

Starting with 8.5.0 through 10.0.1, there is a heap-based buffer overflow in the hb_cairo_glyphs_from_buffer function.

Advisory: https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/security/advisories/GHSA-qmp9-xqm5-jh6m

PoC: https://github.com/fizz-is-on-the-way/poc_vim/blob/main/harfbuzz_poc1?raw=true

CVE-2024-56732: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56732

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-27T21:19:47.000Z ##

Critical overflow in HarfBuzz which TIL:

HarfBuzz is a text shaping engine. It primarily supports OpenType, but also Apple Advanced Typography. HarfBuzz is used in Android, Chrome, ChromeOS, Firefox, GNOME, GTK+, KDE, Qt, LibreOffice, OpenJDK, XeTeX, PlayStation, Microsoft Edge, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Godot Engine, Unreal Engine, and other places.

Starting with 8.5.0 through 10.0.1, there is a heap-based buffer overflow in the hb_cairo_glyphs_from_buffer function.

Advisory: https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/security/advisories/GHSA-qmp9-xqm5-jh6m

PoC: https://github.com/fizz-is-on-the-way/poc_vim/blob/main/harfbuzz_poc1?raw=true

CVE-2024-56732: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56732

cR0w at 2024-12-20T21:26:06.721Z ##

Does anyone use vaultwarden? It has over 40k stars on GitHub so I'm guessing yes. Well, despite being written in rust, it has a sev:HIGH privesc vuln you might want to look into if it's for an organization of more than just yourself: https://github.com/dani-garcia/vaultwarden/security/advisories/GHSA-g65h-982x-4m5m

CVE-2024-56335

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-16T16:32:27.000Z ##

Google Project Zero: The Qualcomm DSP Driver - Unexpectedly Excavating an Exploit
This blog post is a companion piece to Amnesty International's report (see parent toot above): a technical analysis of kernel panic logs generated by an in-the-wild (ITW) exploit, which led to the discovery of 6 vulnerabilities in a Qualcomm driver (one noted by Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) as exploited in the wild). This blog post covers the details of the original artifacts, each of the bugs discovered, and the hypothesized ITW exploit strategy gleaned from the logs. Vulnerabilities explicitly mentioned are CVE-2024-38402, CVE-2024-21455, CVE-2024-33060, CVE-2024-49848, and CVE-2024-43047 (KEV). The Project Zero post ends with a rebuke of Qualcomm for not patching vulnerabilities under the industry standard 90 day deadline, with 49848 still being unfixed 145 days after being reported. "Past research has shown that chipset drivers for Android are a promising target for attackers, and this ITW exploit represents a meaningful real-world example of the negative ramifications that the current third-party vendor driver security posture poses to end-users"

#serbia #spyware #cellebrite #humanrights #privacy #zeroday #vulnerability #bia #novispy #spyware #infosec #cyberthreatintelligence #cybersecurity #CTI #qualcomm
